DOC.HEAD: 12-Year-Old Girl Slain at Mall
DOC.TEXT: A young girl was shot to death at a mall jammed with holiday shoppers, and police arrested a 12-year-old boy following a three-hour search. Jacalyn Calabrese, 12, of Orange, who was shot once in the head at the Mall of Orange, apparently knew the boy, said police Sgt. Art Ramo. The suspect, whose name was not released because of his age, was being questioned late Monday, Romo said. No motive was given. The boy was arrested outside a home about three blocks from the mall after a search by helicopters, police dogs and officers, authorities said. A guard at the Sears department store that anchors one end of the mall said guards from the store chased the boy after Monday evening's shooting, but he escaped. The mall was jammed with holiday shoppers when the shooting occurred, said Maria Jacobs, the Sears' manager.
